question: Which one of the following is the most significant contribution of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel to modern India?
option1: His participation in the Quit India Movement
option2: His role in the Non-Cooperation Movement
option3: His achievement of the integration of princely states
option4: His Presidentship of the Indian National Congress
answer: His achievement of the integration of princely states
explanation: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel acted as Home Minister during the political integration of India and the Indo-Pakistani War of 1947, threatening military force, Patel persuaded almost every princely state to accede to India.
